species.name: HUMAN
species.physicalAppearance: Varies widely. Tend to be tall, lean, or muscular; hair can be blonde, brown, or black. Weight ~90 to 250 lbs.
species.enemies: Wolfen, goblins, hob-goblins, orcs, kobolds, ogres, trolls, changelings, giants
species.allies: Elves, dwarves, gnomes; indifferent toward troglodytes and faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: Any, with leanings toward blade weapons and bows
otherNotes: Explore and master many areas of knowledge (magic, arms, clergy, crafts, arts, etc.)

species.name: ELF
species.physicalAppearance: Tall, slender, and handsome with youthful features. Dark or brown hair, pointed ears, dark eyes; ~150-200 lbs.
species.enemies: Dwarves, trolls, ogres, kobolds, goblins, hobgoblins, orcs, gnomes
species.allies: Humans, faerie folk (pixies, brownies, sprites); generally indifferent toward changelings, troglodytes, and wolfen
species.favoriteWeapons: Large swords, short swords, long bows, knives, and blunt weapons
otherNotes: Elves typically regard wolfen as dangerous and seldom aid them

species.name: DWARF
species.occLimitations: No magic (except Mind Mage), No Long Bowman (too short)
species.physicalAppearance: Short, husky, muscular, with white hair and an aged appearance; ~3–4 ft tall, 100–200 lbs.
species.enemies: Elves, goblins, hob-goblins, orcs, ogres, trolls, and wolfen; also dislike gnomes, changelings, giants
species.allies: Humans, kobolds, troglodytes; indifferent toward faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: Battle axes, ball and chains, blunt weapons, iron staves, slings
otherNotes: Wear all types of armor, especially chain and plate
Have long forsaken most magic (except Mind Mages or witches)

species.name: GOBLIN
species.occLimitations: No magic O.C.C. (except witch and cobbler), No Long Bowman, Knight, or Paladin
species.physicalAppearance: Short and skinny with spindly limbs, large ears, dark eyes, hair color black/brown/red; ~60–100 lbs.
species.enemies: Humans, kobolds, dwarves, elves, gnomes, changelings
species.allies: Hob-goblins, orcs, trolls, wolfen; indifferent toward ogres, troglodytes, giants
species.favoriteWeapons: All weapons except polearms and long bows
otherNotes: Worship evil gods, devils, or demons
Wear any type of armor (prefer studded leather and chain)

species.name: HOB-GOBLIN
species.occLimitations: No magic O.C.C. (except witch), No Long Bowman, Knight, or Paladin
species.physicalAppearance: Gaunt goblins with large ears, dark complexion, dark eyes, stringy hair. ~4–5 ft tall, 90–150 lbs.
specialNaturalAbilities: Natural resistance to psionic attacks (high M.E.)
species.enemies: Humans, elves, gnomes, dwarves, kobolds, changelings
species.allies: Goblins, orcs, trolls, wolfen; indifferent toward ogres, troglodytes, giants
species.favoriteWeapons: Spears, polearms, blunt weapons

species.name: KOBOLD
species.occLimitations: No Long Bowman, Knight, or Paladin
species.physicalAppearance: Short, thin, waxen complexion, bald or white-haired, thick leathery skin, yellow/red eyes, pointed teeth; ~70–120 lbs.
species.enemies: Humans, elves, gnomes, changelings, goblins, hob-goblins
species.allies: Trolls, wolfen, troglodytes, dwarves, giants; indifferent toward orcs and ogres
species.favoriteWeapons: Picks, hammers, knives, swords
otherNotes: Prefer studded, chain, scale, or plate armor

species.name: ORC
species.occLimitations: No magic O.C.C. (except witch and warlock), No Knight or Paladin
species.physicalAppearance: Broad-shouldered, husky, large canine teeth, dark complexion, black/dark brown hair, ~130–240 lbs.
species.enemies: Humans, elves, dwarves, gnomes, changelings
species.allies: Goblins, hob-goblins, trolls, ogres, wolfen; indifferent toward kobolds, troglodytes, giants
species.favoriteWeapons: Any (particularly melee combat)
otherNotes: Worship evil deities, devils, demons, or other dark forces
Claws do 1–6 damage (plus P.S. bonus if applicable), bite does 1–6 (no P.S. bonus)

species.name: OGRE
species.physicalAppearance: Huge, hairy, muscular humanoids with canine teeth and sharp claws. Gray/tan hide, sometimes scaly; ~180–300 lbs.
species.enemies: Humans, elves, dwarves, gnomes, faerie folk, changelings
species.allies: Orcs; dislike/distrust goblins, hob-goblins, kobolds, wolfen, trolls
species.favoriteWeapons: Slings, large swords, axes, blunt weapons
otherNotes: Worship war gods and elemental forces
Claws do 1–8 damage (plus P.S. bonus), bite does 1–6 (no P.S. bonus)

species.name: TROLL
species.occLimitations: None (though they typically choose Mercenary Fighter, Thief, Assassin; seldom dabble in magic)
species.physicalAppearance: Giant, frightful, imposing, powerful claws, fangs, pale blotchy skin, stringy hair, red-rimmed eyes; ~400–600 lbs.
species.enemies: Humans, elves, gnomes
species.allies: Kobolds, goblins, hob-goblins, orcs, giants; indifferent toward wolfen, dwarves, troglodytes, ogres, changelings
species.favoriteWeapons: Large blade weapons, sickles, scythes, axes, picks, large swords
otherNotes: Wear all types of armor (especially leather)
Claws do 2–12 damage (plus P.S. bonus), bite does 2–12 (no P.S. bonus)

species.name: TROGLODYTE
species.occLimitations: Limited to O.C.C. of Mercenary Fighter, Thief, Assassin, Priest, Shaman, and Healer ONLY
species.physicalAppearance: Broad-shouldered, pale skin, large dark eyes, flabby body, reptilian/amphibian-like head; ~130–250 lbs.
species.enemies: Generally fear or dislike all surface dwellers
species.allies: Indifferent toward other subterranean races (dwarves, kobolds, gnomes, goblins)
species.favoriteWeapons: Thrown rocks, cudgels, stone axes, stone hammers, stone tools, wooden clubs
otherNotes: Often worship nymph or elemental deities
Wear little or no clothing (no armor)
Rarely use metal weapons unless found
No worldly goods (though like sparkly items)
Claws do 6 damage (plus P.S. bonus), bite 1–6 (no P.S. bonus)

species.name: CHANGELING
species.physicalAppearance: Naturally tall, thin, ambiguous features, but can shift shape to appear as any humanoid between 3–10 feet tall. Mass can vary ~30 lbs.
specialNaturalAbilities: Shape-shift into any humanoid form within size range (1 full melee round)
Cannot shift into animals or objects
Genderless; can appear male or female
Physical attributes remain constant (lost limb remains lost in all forms)
species.enemies: Generally distrusted or feared by all races
species.allies: Often prefer company of elves, humans, wolfen, orcs, trolls
species.favoriteWeapons: Any
otherNotes: Tend to be suspicious of strangers

species.name: GNOME
species.occLimitations: Limited to O.C.C. of Mercenary Fighter, Ranger, Thief, Assassin, Clergy, and Magic O.C.C. (except Mind Mage)
species.physicalAppearance: Very short and handsome, white hair, bushy eyebrows, sparkling blue eyes. Males have neatly trimmed beards. ~20–50 lbs.
species.enemies: Kobolds, trolls, dwarves, goblins, hobgoblins, orcs, ogres
species.allies: Humans, elves, faerie folk; indifferent toward troglodytes, changelings, wolfen
species.favoriteWeapons: Knives, short swords, slings, short bows, crossbows (gnome-sized gear deals less damage)
otherNotes: Gnomes and dwarves are cousins but fiercely dislike each other

species.name: WOLFEN
species.alignment: Any (often principled or aberrant, with a strong code of honor)
species.physicalAppearance: Giant humanoid wolves, fur typically dark or light gray, pronounced muzzle, sharp canine teeth, powerful jaws. ~190–300 lbs.
specialNaturalAbilities: Excellent sense of smell and hearing (+80% to tracking by scent)
species.enemies: Humans, dwarves, changelings
species.allies: Goblins, hob-goblins, kobolds, orcs, ogres, trolls; indifferent toward gnomes, troglodytes, giants, faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: Pole arms, ball and chain, swords, axes
otherNotes: Provide aid and protection to those who request it
Claws: 1–6 plus O.C.C./P.S. bonus; bite: 1–8 (no P.S. bonus)

species.name: FAERIE (Common)
species.occLimitations: None (typically do not choose an O.C.C.)
species.physicalAppearance: Tiny winged humanoid, extremely attractive
species.enemies: Generally disliked by most non-faerie races
species.allies: Other faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: None (often rely on mischief or magic)

species.name: FAERIE (Silver Bells)
species.physicalAppearance: Tiny winged faeries with a musical, chiming voice and bright coloration
species.enemies: Disliked by most non-faerie folk
species.allies: Other faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: None typically
otherNotes: Often seen at dawn playing in the morning sun

species.name: FAERIE (Green Wood)
species.alignment: Any (tend to be unprincipled or anarchist)
species.physicalAppearance: Tiny winged faeries, often with a greenish tint; closely tied to forests
species.enemies: Generally distrusted by most non-faerie folk
species.allies: Other faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: Tiny bows/arrows (faerie weapons)
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: charm, grow plants, animate plants, circle of rain, circle of flame, faeries' dance

species.name: FAERIE (Night-Elves)
species.physicalAppearance: Tiny faeries with a nocturnal, shadowy vibe; still winged and delicate
species.enemies: Generally disliked by non-faerie folk
species.allies: Other faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: Tiny faerie weapons (if any)
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: mesmerism, mend wood/clay, ventriloquism, turn self into mist, faeries' dance

species.name: PIXIE
species.physicalAppearance: Small, slender, fiery red hair, fair complexion, no wings yet can magically fly
species.enemies: Disliked by most people for pranks
species.allies: Other faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: If any, tiny or improvised
otherNotes: May wear soft leather armor (S.D.C. 10, A.R. 8)
Knows faerie magic: charm, cloud of slumber, wind rush, sphere of light, mend wood/clay, tongue, circle of rain

species.name: FROST-PIXIE
species.physicalAppearance: Small, wingless faerie folk with a frosty or icy coloration; can fly via magic
specialNaturalAbilities: Finger of frost (touch attack, 2 damage + possible stun if fail save vs magic)
Frost breath (range 4 ft, 1–6 damage, blinds 1–6 melee rounds unless save vs magic)
species.enemies: Generally disliked by non-faerie folk, blamed for cold snaps and hail
species.allies: Other faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: Rarely use weapons
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: wind rush, north wind, freeze water, hail, snow storm, wall of ice

species.name: LEPRECHAUN
species.occLimitations: None (faerie shoemaker/tailor, not usually an O.C.C.)
species.alignment: Any, but almost always anarchist (unprincipled or miscreant likely)
species.physicalAppearance: Small, often bearded faerie folk, whimsical and sly
species.enemies: Generally disliked by larger folk for trickery
species.allies: All faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: Primarily trickery, illusions; rarely normal weapons
otherNotes: Super greedy (hoards gold, gems, or magic items)
Lives in secluded places, usually alone

species.name: BROWNIE
species.physicalAppearance: Tiny, shy, unarmored faerie folk; considered the most liked among faeries
species.enemies: Primarily disliked by malicious beings
species.allies: Other faerie folk; sometimes friendly with kind mortals
species.favoriteWeapons: None; they never use weapons
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: mend wood/clay, cloud of slumber, animate objects
Shy but still fond of mild pranks

species.name: SPRITE (Tree Sprite)
species.physicalAppearance: Tiny winged faerie folk strongly tied to trees and forests
species.enemies: Disliked by evil folk who hate faeries
species.allies: Other faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: None; do not typically use weapons
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: animate plants, charm, faeries' dance

species.name: SPRITE (Water Sprite)
species.physicalAppearance: Tiny winged faerie folk fond of ponds, lakes, streams
species.enemies: Generally disliked by those who despise faeries
species.allies: Other faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: None
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: circle of rain, create fog, purple mist

species.name: SPRITE (Wind-Puff)
species.physicalAppearance: Tiny winged faeries associated with breezes and gusts
species.enemies: Non-faerie folk who resent mischief
species.allies: Other faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: None typically
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: charm, mend wood/clay, faeries' dance
Never wear clothes or armor, travel in groups of 6 to 36

species.name: SPRIGGAN
species.physicalAppearance: Small, gnarled, stony-skinned faerie folk, solitary builders
specialNaturalAbilities: Pass through stone, rock, clay as if air
species.enemies: Generally disliked by most people
species.allies: Occasionally other faerie folk (often work alone)
species.favoriteWeapons: Rarely use weapons
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: dust storm, mend stone, crumble stone, rock to mud

species.name: NYMPH
species.physicalAppearance: Ethereally beautiful, can appear as a small winged being; associated with nature’s bounty
specialNaturalAbilities: Only magic can harm them (in some lore)
species.enemies: Evil beings who would harm nature
species.allies: Other faerie folk, some good-aligned mortals
species.favoriteWeapons: None
otherNotes: Knows powerful faerie magic (10th-level potency): cloud of slumber, dust storm, create fog, purple mist, call lightning, grow plants, animate plants, extinguish fires, wind rush, part waters, calm waters, wall of thorns, breath of life

species.name: BOGIES
species.physicalAppearance: Small faerie able to polymorph into large spiders, scorpions, or centipedes; adept climbers
species.enemies: All non-faerie (they love to scare or harm them)
species.allies: Other mischievous faerie folk
species.favoriteWeapons: They may use small weapons or illusions
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: wind rush, fog of fear, wisps of confusion, purple mist, sphere of light, mesmerism, ventriloquism, animate objects
Tricks or hurts non-faerie folk, disliked by them

species.name: TOAD STOOLS
species.physicalAppearance: Faerie fungus-like beings able to morph into true toads
specialNaturalAbilities: Polymorph into a true toad at will
species.enemies: Hated by most people
species.allies: Rarely any; sometimes other malicious faeries
species.favoriteWeapons: None
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: create fog, animate plants

species.name: PUCK
species.physicalAppearance: Dirty grey complexion, can polymorph into goat, dog, pony, or wild boar. Cruel, depraved
species.enemies: Most civilized folk (they are cruel tricksters)
species.allies: May travel in pairs or small groups
species.favoriteWeapons: Short blade weapons; may wear leather armor
otherNotes: Evil, depraved, rarely more than 8 in a group

species.name: SATYRS
species.physicalAppearance: Goat-like faerie folk (goat legs, humanoid torso), often malicious or mischievous
specialNaturalAbilities: Speaks all tongues of the faerie folk
species.enemies: Often disliked by mortals for malice
species.allies: Other faerie folk or savage creatures
species.favoriteWeapons: Crude tools and weapons (clubs, staves, cudgels)
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: change direction of wind, create mild wind, howling wind
Run in packs, malicious and mischievous

species.name: WILL-O-THE-WISP
species.averageHeight: Incorporeal or tree-dwelling shape; no standard height
species.physicalAppearance: Glowing presence often inhabiting a tree with human-like features
specialNaturalAbilities: Animate/control its tree (4 attacks per melee in combat, 1–6 or 2–6 damage by branch)
species.enemies: Varies (often opposed by evil that threatens its domain)
species.allies: Faerie folk, friendly creatures
species.favoriteWeapons: None (uses living tree limbs)
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: circle of rain, call lightning, extinguish fires, mend wood/clay, sphere of light, wind rush, create fog, purple mist
May guard a faerie friend’s treasure

species.name: MERMAIDS
species.physicalAppearance: Humanoid upper body, fishtail lower body, often dangerous sea witches
specialNaturalAbilities: Song of the damned (special faerie magic style)
species.enemies: Sailors, land dwellers they choose to ensnare
species.allies: Possibly allied sea creatures if equally malicious
species.favoriteWeapons: Often rely on magic or enthralling songs
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: charm, love charm, mesmerism, create fog, part waters, (summon) storm
Often keep undersea treasures, ride dolphins/whales

species.name: MERROWS
species.averageHeight: Similar to mermaids but can be larger or smaller variants
species.physicalAppearance: Humanoid upper body, fish-like tail; friendlier than mermaids
species.enemies: Occasional conflicts with evil sea creatures
species.allies: Often friendly with dolphins, whales, seals, walruses
species.favoriteWeapons: Seldom use weapons, prefer peaceful existence
otherNotes: Knows faerie magic: calm storm, summon storm, part waters, create fog, wind rush, charm
Love to play and chase in the sea

species.name: ALGOR GIANT
species.occLimitations: Any except Thief, Paladin, and Longbowman
species.physicalAppearance: Pale white or pale blue skin, golden/silver hair, dark eyes, ~500–1200 lbs
specialNaturalAbilities: Frost Breath (range 30 ft, 6 ft wide, does 4–24 damage)
species.enemies: Elves, dwarves, humans; dislike orcs, goblins, hob-goblins
species.allies: Wolfen, trolls, jotans, cyclops; indifferent to others
species.favoriteWeapons: Giant-sized axes, ball and chain, pole arms

species.name: CYCLOPS GIANT
species.physicalAppearance: Olive skin, one large central eye, long dark hair, ~500–1000 lbs
species.enemies: Titans, changelings, trolls
species.allies: Kobolds, ogres, jotan, gigantes, nimro, dragons
species.favoriteWeapons: Javelins, large swords, spears, bows, slings (giant-sized)
otherNotes: Very greedy, wear heavy armor, often worshipped by kobolds

species.name: JOTAN GIANT
species.occLimitations: Men of arms, clergy, witch, or warlock
species.alignment: Any (tend to be evil or selfish)
species.physicalAppearance: Huge, bronze-skinned, dark eyes, brown hair, ~700–1600 lbs
species.enemies: Titans, elves, humans, dwarves, gnomes
species.allies: Cyclops, nimro, trolls, ogres, orcs, goblins
species.favoriteWeapons: Large swords, axes, ball and chain, blunt weapons

species.name: GIGANTES GIANT
species.occLimitations: Men of arms, clergy, or witch
species.physicalAppearance: Humanoid giant with possible extra limbs/features; ~450–1000 lbs
specialNaturalAbilities: Roll four random abilities (night vision, see invisible, impervious to fire, etc.)
species.enemies: Titans, elves, humans, dwarves, wolfen, gnomes, troglodytes, changelings
species.allies: Cyclops, trolls, ogres, orcs, goblins
species.favoriteWeapons: Blade, blunt (giant-sized)
otherNotes: Extremely hostile, worship gods of darkness, titans are arch-enemies

species.name: NIMRO GIANT
species.occLimitations: Any except knight, paladin, or longbowman
species.physicalAppearance: Copper or red skin, black/red-brown hair, yellow eyes, ~500–1200 lbs
species.enemies: Titans, elves, dwarves, humans, changelings, gnomes
species.allies: Jotan, gigantes, ogres, trolls, orcs, goblins
species.favoriteWeapons: Large swords, blade weapons, blunt weapons
otherNotes: Wear any armor, large tribes at Mt. Nimro
Desire to build a giant kingdom

species.name: TITAN GIANT
species.occLimitations: Men of arms, Healer, Wizard, Warlock
species.physicalAppearance: Majestic giant men/women, golden/silver/brown hair, warm eyes, ~400–900 lbs
species.enemies: Gigantes, jotan, gods of darkness, ogres, trolls, kobolds, orcs, goblins, and all evil/injustice
species.allies: Gods of light, champions of justice/goodness
species.favoriteWeapons: Large swords, ball and chain, pole arms, battle axe, longbow, sling

classes.name: Noble
classes.requirements: I.Q. 7, 200 gold (Same as Men at Arms)

MenAtArms.note: Soldiers start with the same but receive extra equipment upon enlistment.

psionics.description: Psionics (Extra Sensory Perception, or ESP) are paranormal mental powers such as telepathy, empathy, and telekinesis. They are hereditary traits shared by humans and other intelligent lifeforms.
psionics.determiningProcedure: Roll 1d100 under GM supervision to determine psionic ability.

minor.abilities: Limited to Level 1 psionic abilities. Roll percentile dice for each of the 12 Level 1 abilities (60% chance each).
minor.innerStrengthPoints: Base I.S.P. equals Mental Endurance (M.E.). At each new level, roll 1d6 and add the result.

major.abilities: Access to Levels 1-3. At Level 1, roll for Level 1 abilities; at Level 2, roll for 13 Level 2 abilities; at Level 3, roll for Level 3 abilities. No further psionic abilities are gained past Level 3.
major.innerStrengthPoints: Base I.S.P. equals M.E. At each new level, roll 1d8 and add the result.

master.abilities: Access to Levels 1-10. At Level 1, roll for Level 1 abilities; each subsequent level grants new abilities corresponding to that psionic level.
master.innerStrengthPoints: Base I.S.P. equals M.E. At each new level, roll 1d8 and add the result.

mindMage.description: Mind Mages are dedicated to mastering their mental abilities. They automatically know and can use all psionic abilities as they manifest (no rolls required).
mindMage.innerStrengthPoints: Base I.S.P. equals M.E., then roll 1d20 and add the result. For each new level, add an additional 10 I.S.P.
